review_text:
So, I have to be completely upfront and say that the Bluefield area was not for me. I had been looking for a place to spend some quiet time close to the mountains while working remotely, but unfortunately this was not it. As a single female traveler, I didn’t feel completely safe in the area. I had gone off previous reviews and booked for a month, but ended up leaving less than halfway through. I am very conflicted in writing this review, and take responsibility for the fact that I wasn’t familiar with the town, but also feel like some additional information would have been helpful as it would have influenced my decision to book.
First let me say, the suite itself was nice - exactly as described, looked newly renovated, clean, and had basically everything one needed. The internet was good for working remotely. Also, the bed was very comfortable as other reviews have said. Hal was responsive and kind. To his credit, he tried to do what he could to make me more comfortable. The only downside was the windows in the unit didn’t open and actually seemed to be sealed shut in some cases. Hal did offer to try to get the windows open, but at that point I knew I wasn’t staying and didn’t want to make him go through the effort for me to then leave.
However, a few things I wish I knew before booking. First, the surrounding area leaves a bit to be desired. There are a lot of boarded up, empty buildings and the neighborhood backs up to a very industrial looking area on a busy street, which made me question the safety of the neighborhood. Unfortunately, AirBnB policy doesn’t require information about the location, but I feel like it is an important aspect of a stay, especially for longer stays. Also, the houses are very close together, much closer than I was expecting. So, even though the house had a nice porch, and you can see the mountains in the distance, sitting out there really only gave you a view of the neighbor’s yards, the empty buildings, and the noise from the busy street. Oh, and please know that the other part of the house is under renovation. I didn’t hear any noise from it but it does mean that it is currently empty.
Not an issue, just an FYI, there is a pretty steep incline to the house. I have an AWD SUV arriving on a clear day and it still gave me some trouble. Be careful if you don’t have AWD or there is inclement weather. But the driveway side is even worse, so definitely use the alley.
Again, these are just some things I would have liked to known, so please take this review in context. If the above items aren’t a concern for you or you are someone who is visiting for a specific purpose and is more familiar with the area, it would most likely be a great stay. It just wasn’t the right fit for me.

My husband once said that we don’t really have dew where we live and I wish I’d paid more attention to that, because dew in WV is like the morning after a deluge where I’m from. You might think you just want to go for a quick walk up the path, but it’s too tempting to see what’s around the bend to have inadequate shoes.

Only suggestion I’d make is this - Don’t let your man child, step father play with the simply safe alarm. He will without a doubt set it off and it makes a very embarrassing phone call to the host to shut off.
I try not to only list positives, on the rare occasion that I do leave a review. I must admit it was tough finding a negative for this property. If I had to list something, I’d say just know there is no central AC in the house. We visited in July and it was in the mid 90s outside, so it was very toasty in the house upon our arrival. review_text: This is a great place to relax and enjoy the benefits of a large piece of land with fields and forests that our dogs enjoyed exploring for hours. It was very clean inside with plenty of amenities for cooking, grilling, and entertainment (games, TV, music). I would characterize the inside as relaxed and homey, with comfortable sofas and chairs, woven rugs, ceiling fans, and nature photos. The bath towels were plush and the king bed was very comfortable. We enjoyed sitting on the back deck looking at fireflies over the fields in the evening and having breakfast and dinner on the front porch. The location is good for visiting beautiful sites of southern West Virginia, including New River Gorge (and other associated National Parks) and Pipestem Resort and State Park on the Bluestone River. The local Bluefield City Park also has a nice trail network, and nearby Cabin Creek State Park has some waterfalls and trails to see. As one of the highest elevation cities east of the Rockies, Bluefield is known as "Natures Air-Conditioned City", and we observed that daytime temps in July were 8-10 degrees cooler than back home in the Baltimore-Washington corridor, which was great for spending time outdoors. The main road is pretty busy at times but the house is back far enough (several hundred feet) that there was no issue with the dogs getting anywhere near it. Lisa is very responsive to any queries and was a pleasure to interact with.

To book here I would suggest only a 4 wheel drive, and to have at least 1 very capable outdoorsy person on the trip.
The cabin is very isolated, we didn't see a single person during the whole 3 days we were there. We hiked part of the the trail by the house but the hills were so steep we were out of breath after about 10 mins and headed back.
The nearby town is at the bottom of the mountain, which is great, but wow the drive up/down the gravel roads is intense! They are narrow and often very steep. If you combine it with snow, you could really struggle to get to and from the cabin.
It snowed the last night we were there, and we lost power for 3-4 hours which was scary. Luckily power was restored quickly.
It took us over 30 minutes to pull out of the driveway due to the snow and loose gravel (we had a 2WD compact SUV). For a while I thought we would be stranded there until the snow cleared but we managed to make it out.
Would recommend for outdoor people who want isolation.

We had a great time with rain only 3 times but was short lived, not all day. The cabin had plenty of space for the 6 of us, ate outside most of the time because of the nice weather. review_text: This is a lovely place and it's just as advertised. The view of the valley from the deck and from windows across most of the front of the house is the big selling point, but there are a lot of great things about this cabin. The living space is very comfortable, the kitchen is well appointed, and there's a ton of light. Outdoor space is great, and there's an area under the deck where we could store our mountain bikes out of the weather. Nice fireplace, as well, and plenty of wood (and we left a bit more than we found). We don't usually watch tv on vacation, but there's a huge tv over the fireplace and plenty of channels to pick from, along with a fancy sound system hooked to Alexa. Internet was adequate, and we "worked from home" using the wifi and supplementing with our phones (stong cell service allowed for Zoom calls, no problem). We saw wild turkeys and deer right from the cabin, and enjoyed the trails, too (although a bit steep in places for mountain bikes, at least at our skill level). There's an interesting hike/mountain bike ride on the gravel road that goes up along the ridge (I think this is the tail end of state route 662). It's fairly level after the initial climb from the cabin, is car-accessible but really lightly traveled. And no issues for us getting down/up the gravel driveway (although I'm sure it'd be interesting in snow, but could walk the last 100 yards if needed, as is noted elsewhere). The owner also has a lot of great local tips! We hiked the AT out of Little Wolf Creek Primitive Management Area, about 45 minutes drive, well worth it. And we found most anything we needed in Bluefield WV. Overall this is a great property, with a lot to do and see, super comfortable space, and a lot of small touches that are very well thought out (sound system, kitchen gadgets, indoor and outdoor fireplaces, etc.) We highly recommend!

It is furnished with style, has TVs in almost every room, is comfortable, and well stocked with appliances and cooking implements. We even found lots of food and condiments in the cabinets and fridge. The deck is private, has a nice view and is perfect for relaxing in the sun and/or reading a book. While we were there we saw plenty of wildlife (deer, wild turkeys...) and we were visited multiple times by a mid-size bear who seems to routinely walk by the cabin at or right after sunset. Once he stole our garbage and disseminated it in the woods which was fun to catch on camera but not so fun afterwards when we had to pick it all up. The only down side of the cabin is its location: it is very remote and isolated. It takes a good 15+ minutes on a dirt road to get up or down and, especially after the recent heavy rains, the dirt road had washed out, had deep ruts and had become hard to negotiate for a regular car. Overall we had a really good time at the cabin and we recommend it to all who want a peaceful and relaxing time.

My trip at Corbyns cabin was amazing. First the mountain drive up was a lot less intimidating than the directions and reviews made it out to be. Yes it’s mountain driving on a gravel road but that’s it. Also the driveway is a bit steep and also gravel so some vehicles may have difficulty with it but parking at the top is only about a 500ft walk to the cabin so it’s not terrible of a walk if you decide it’s to steep.
Now on to the good stuff. This cabin was immaculate when it comes to cleanliness which is always important to me.
It is secluded to where you don’t see any neighbors and you don’t hear a sound from other cabins or town. You truly are in a mountain escape. Most cabins I have rented were on cliff edges and in a row of cabins with your neighbor being 10 feet away so having a secluded 18 acre lot was amazing. Now as for the view again to get this type of view you typically have to be on a cliff side somewhere with a steep drop off which isn’t safe for smaller children. Not at this cabin. Here there is a nice acre at least of cleared area where kids can run, play, and explore and older kids could even be trusted to go down the trails to the creek and play. It’s also perfect for a well trained off leash pup to get to be a dog in the wild. My pup a golden retriever has never had the ability to safely wonder away from me but here she did great and was able to explore a little.
The kitchen was also stocked with anything and everything I could think of using (pots, pans, utensils, spices, oil, common condiments, and a few foods the prior guests left behind) I would beware of expiration dates but I just threw out what wasn’t in date anymore. I was a little surprised that it didn’t have a dishwasher though. However, even though I hate washing my own dishes it wasn’t enough to deter me from loving this cabin.
The master king size bed was sooooo comfortable and seemed to be a sleep number of sorts where you could pick the softness or firmness of the mattress which was a good surprise. I slept so soundly the first evening. Also the garden tub in the master bath was nice to relax in after a day of hiking the trails.
I would gladly rent this cabin again and in fact am currently considering returning in July with my parents and brothers children to allow my brother and his wife a get away without the kiddos.
